alert.note: Alert for Arthur; Keith; Lincoln; McPherson; Perkins (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 12:58AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Arthur, eastern Perkins, Keith, northwestern Lincoln and McPherson Counties through 200 AM CDT/100 AM MDT/... At 1257 AM CDT/1157 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lemoyne to near Roscoe to near Grant. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ogallala, Grant, Tryon, Sutherland, Hershey, Paxton, Sarben, Ringgold, Lemoyne, Keystone, Sutherland Reservoir, Roscoe, Kingsley Dam, Coker, O`Fallons, Nevens, Broganville, Lake View Campground, Big Bald Hill and Wild Horse Spring. This includes the following highways... Highway 61 between mile markers 64 and 76, and between mile markers 84 and 106. Highway 92 between mile markers 131 and 138, and between mile markers 185 and 216. Highway 97 between mile markers 3 and 43. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 125 and 166. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
